comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 GTB7.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 GTB7.1

Every time I update to the latest version of Firefox, when I click on email on link an error popup happens.  The below is the error message.

General failure. The URL was: "http://www.someURL.com" The system cannot find the file specified. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.got to outlook 2007
2.click on any link in email
3. get error popup


Expected Results:  
no error should happen, should go directly to link.

There is a fix for it, but I have to do the fix every time I do update with your company.

Fix is:
(Note: These instructions apply to Windows Vista and 7 only.)

1. Click Start, type regedit, and then press Enter.

2. Navigate to the following entry: HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\FirefoxURL\shell\open\ddeexec

3. In the center pane, double-click the Default entry, then remove whatever value is there (it'll probably be a weird string of numbers and commas).

4. Click OK, then exit Regedit.

5. If Outlook and/or Firefox are open, close them, then restart them
comments.creator: BOZO@CBRADIOTALK.COM
comments.author: BOZO@CBRADIOTALK.COM
